pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:0.5: 9. The second training rule on disposing of feces
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.2: At that time a brahmin had a barley field next to the nuns’ dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.3: The nuns disposed of feces, urine, trash, and food scraps in that field.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.4: The brahmin complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.5: “How can the nuns spoil my barley field?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.6: The nuns heard the complaints of that brahmin,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.7: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.8: “How can nuns dispose of feces, urine, trash, and food scraps on cultivated plants?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.12: “How can nuns dispose of feces, urine, trash, and food scraps on cultivated plants?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.14: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:1.15.1: ‘If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps on cultivated plants, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.12: food remnants or bones or used water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.14: grain, vegetables, whatever cultivated plants people consider valuable or useful.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.16: if she disposes of it herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.18: if she asks another, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.1.19: If she only asks once, then even if the other disposes of such things many times, she commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.1: If they are cultivated plants, and she perceives them as such, and she disposes of it or has it disposed of, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.2: If they are cultivated plants, but she is unsure of it, and she disposes of it or has it disposed of, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.3: If they are cultivated plants, but she perceives them as uncultivated, and she disposes of it or has it disposed of, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.4: If they are uncultivated plants, but she perceives them as cultivated, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.5: If they are uncultivated plants, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.2.6: If they are uncultivated plants, and she perceives them as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.2: if she disposes of it after having looked;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.3: if she disposes of it at the edge of the field;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.4: if she disposes of it after asking and getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc9:2.3.7: The ninth training rule is finished.
